website_summaries.verdict: Available in different sizes and sold as a 3-pack, these warm and durable socks present an impressive value.
pros: Thick, comfortable socks made of 75% merino wool
These are tall socks that come up over calves and don’t fall down, even on athletic calves
Keep feet warm without causing them to overheat or sweat
Keep feet dry even if shoes get wet
cons: These may shrink a bit in the dryer

customer_reviews.title: Fair value.
customer_reviews.text: At about $5/pair these are good and comfortable socks especially for anyone like me that struggles with feet that go from hot and sweaty to ice cold when I wear cotton socks. These socks have weak seams that pull apart from each other but maybe they will be okay in the long run. I also own better named socks at about $20+/pair and the difference is vast. But, at one fifth of that cost these cheaper socks are a fair value.
customer_reviews.author: A. Boese

customer_reviews.title: SOCK HEAVEN!!!
customer_reviews.text: OH MY GOSH!!! I bought these socks when I started wearing 8" hiking/military spec boots for the added ankle support. SOCK HEAVEN. It is no exaggeration that these are The Most Comfortable Socks that I have ever worn in my 58 years upon this planet. I am on medication that causes me to sweat in copious amounts and with 8" boots I feared my feet would suffer. Nope. Nope. And Nope. Dry and cozy. I only purchased 2 sets of 3 but I will be getting more so I can last more than a week between washings.
customer_reviews.author: Karen D.

customer_reviews.title: Best of the Best!
customer_reviews.text: Soft comfortable fit having neuropathy in my feet they are constantly freezing even if outside in the 100's. These help reduce the feeling of cold feet, cushioned them to the ruff terrain of LA sidewalks. Have nine other pairs of different thickness and each fit well and do their job above and beyond. In cold weather you shouldn't have sweaty feet, I have yet to have sweaty feet or even damp feet since I started buy these wool socks.
customer_reviews.author: rleigh1250

customer_reviews.title: comfy, but lacking in compression
customer_reviews.text: They are nice and soft. Good amount of padding and comfortable. The only thing I'll caution is that the elastic is stretchy enough to hold the sock to my foot, but there is zero compression, which is common in other hiking socks. I was doing some PT the other day in my socks and I found that my foot was sticking to the tread on an incline, but my foot was sliding around inside the sock. I wouldn't expect this in a hiking or gym sock with stronger elastic. Once inside a shoe or boot, however, they seem fine. This may be a little nitpicky, but I just thought I'd mention it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Askov

customer_reviews.title: Holes after two months
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these socks 2 months ago and was initially pleased with them and excited about their comfort. I noticed today that the socks have what appears to be “worn” holes on the sole. I wear them indoors or else with shoes, so the wear is unexplainable. All I can think is that they are of poor quality. I included a photo to prove that the hole is not a tear but seems to be due to thinning of the material. Like I said, initially they were comfortable but a high price tag is unjustified for two months worth of wear.
customer_reviews.author: J. Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: Versatility in Wooly Goodness
customer_reviews.text: Whoever said wool socks were itchy has never worn MERIWOOL Merino Wool Blend socks. These are super comfortable. I could wear them for days. Aside from reinforcing my heels on long hikes, I have worn these after a night out in heels, and they make for great protection of blistered ankles/heels. Slap a band-aid on your blister (or open wound, yikes) and slide in to these cozy bad boys; you've got cloud-like support and enforcement. Win win in my book - function, form, and versatility all in one.
customer_reviews.author: Angela S.

customer_reviews.title: Game changer.
customer_reviews.text: First let me say that I work 10hr days, in a factory, and wear an assortment of shoes there, and outside of work (work boots, Merrill hiking boots, new balance sneakers, and supra skate shoes). I ALWAYS have sweaty, smelly feet by the end of the day. I am always warm, and uncomfortable. These socks changed my life. I am totally comfortable in these socks all day long, no overheating, and when I get home, there is no smell when I take my shoes off, and my feet are never damp. I will wear these in all 4 seasons.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Rago

customer_reviews.title: Great socks!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these socks for a two week trek in Peru. They were awesome! Used them with a thin liner and they kept my feet warm and cozy but weren't too hot for the Amazon heat.
customer_reviews.author: angie willhite

customer_reviews.title: Thick and well cushioned.
customer_reviews.text: Quite thick and cushiony. Generous toe box. Thicker than I was imagining so they won't work with all shoes but overall appears to be a quality well made shorter boot sock. May have too much volume for smaller women's feet. I wear a size 9 and the unisex small could be a little snugger and that probably means it would be too large on a small woman's foot. Keeping these in mind when you order I would say they're an excellent socks.
customer_reviews.author: Marina McShane

customer_reviews.title: Itchy socks because of inferior wool. Package says "merino wool blend" instead of saying "merino wool"
customer_reviews.text: The product says merino wool on the product description but the packaging for the sock says "merino wool blend". Which means the percentage of merino wool is actually a blend of merino wool and what I believe to be inferior wool due to it being crazily itchy. Even after washing (hang dry). I have tried several different brands of merino wool socks found on amazon and these are my least favorite. TL:DR -itchy from inferior wool -kinda tight and not stretchy -package says "merino wool blend" instead of "merino wool" and then giving a percentage -worst of the merino wool socks I've tried on Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Best socks for older feet
customer_reviews.text: warm but breathable, soft but tough. Don't know if I'm losing my sense of smell but they don't even seem to stink, even after days of wearing around the house as slippers. Bought a three pack for an older friend with complaints of constant cold feet. She LOVES their warm, dry comfort. I'd buy more for myself but the three pack rotates perfectly with my laundry cycle and they are not wearing out! I've noticed with age, as my feet grow more sensitive, I need more cushioning in my shoes. These are a perfect thickness for my Dr Martin's boots. Not too much volume, not too little. These even make my trainer's more comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Warm and durable
customer_reviews.text: These keep your feet nice and warm even when it’s cold out. I wear these regularly in the winter as everyday socks with boots and they have held up extremely well. I have Raynauds and these are the first socks I’ve found that mostly prevent it.
customer_reviews.author: Prindy

customer_reviews.title: Lost my both big toenails
customer_reviews.text: These socks are comfortable but caused me serious injuries. I lost both my toenails from huge blisters after hiking for 3 days in these. I don't know if this is because they were not broken in but the damage far outweighs the comfort. Now my feet will look freakish and messed up all summer. I am really weird about my feet when my feet are uncomfortable my whole world is uncomfortable so this is a big deal to me and I am extremely displeased. I am returning.
customer_reviews.author: David D. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: These are my favorite socks even though I have a hard time finding ...
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite socks even though I have a hard time finding them. I had to look a bit too much to find wool socks that are actually mostly wool. Misleading when lots of the socks being marketed as wool are mostly cotton, but that is not the case for these. I live in Northern California and by no means do we have real winters, but having your feet warm just make the cold-ish days all the better. These paired with my timberland boots is a great match for cold environments. I love wearing these socks around the house. Comfy comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Very warm and comfortable. Excellent Value.-My Favorites!
customer_reviews.text: Shrinks significantly with machine wash and dry- 1 to 2 sizes- but that increases thickness & density!!. Always wash/dry inside-out as recommended. Cushy and comfortable with lot's of stretchy elastic to compensate for shrinkage and gives us a top cuff that does not cut off blood flow. Breaths well so should be good for all but the hottest and coldest days - perhaps in the range of 15-85 degrees depending on activity level- eight month utility anyway and year round indoors use for sure. May not fit largest sizes after shrinkage but for me they most comfortable socks I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Sj Construction

customer_reviews.title: itchy
customer_reviews.text: I've had merino wool socks from multiple brands and these are by far the worst, you might as well get regular wool socks, the fit is nice, they are nice thick socks, but the itch factor is too high to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Perry

customer_reviews.title: *@ing Love These Socks
customer_reviews.text: These socks are amazing. I got the because I was going to be wearing steel toe boots every weekday for about 6 weeks in a warm environment. They were sock and had enough cushion to keep my feet comfortable in work boots, but they also did not ever feel too warm. However, now that I'm back in a cold weather, they're great for that, too. I wore them to a football game that was probably the most miserable weather I've ever experienced at a sporting event and my feet felt fine. It's weird writing a passionate review about socks, but these socks deserve it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Bryant

customer_reviews.title: These Are TERRIFIC Socks
customer_reviews.text: For years, I've bought SmartWool socks. But the last time I was getting ready for a trip, I thought, "these socks are ridiculously expensive." And I decided to check on Amazon. I found the Meriwool socks. I read the reviews. People thought the socks might run a bit too large. And, yes, that was true, right out of the package (and I had bought the small). But after I washed them, they were perfect. They've been holding up really well as I thump around my house in socks on wooden floors. And wear them daily for hikes. So I DO recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Grammy from Arlington

customer_reviews.title: For toothpick legs only:
customer_reviews.text: The opening in these (size large) when relaxed is approx. two inches in diameter, and becomes somewhat difficult to stretch when stretched to three inches and beyond. If I would have attempted to wear these, they would have cut off every bit of circulation to my foot. Also, to call these "wool" is a stretch, I have wool socks, and these look and feel nothing like wool. Guess they have a sheep that sneezes on these so they can call them "Merino".
customer_reviews.author: Michael Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase, quality and the price is GREAT when compared to SmartWool.
customer_reviews.text: These are GREAT socks at a really good price point. The high merino Wool amount really makes them warm and they are well made. For a 3 pack I used to pay the same or more for a single pair of SmartWool socks and these are just as good. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: W. Padgett

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable socks that will keep your feet dry
customer_reviews.text: These socks are nice and comfortable. There is definitely a noticeable difference (positive) when I wear these with my boots. They're on the really thick side, so make sure to take this into account with whatever shoes you decide to wear them with. I haven't taken them to extreme cold or gone snowboarding with them, so my experience is limited but positive.
customer_reviews.author: Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Came highly recommended, they're good to go
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to find good socks these days for a good price there are great socks on the market but they're very expensive. These socks in their reviews came highly recommended by a first responder who works in foreign tropical environments with high heat and humidity. I have not worn these socks in those conditions but I have worn them in the summer and at work and they do provide moisture wicking with comfort and support without overheating my feet. My feet and body is pretty sensitive to overheating from exposure to polyester but I do not have that problem with these socks as they are not 100% wool.
customer_reviews.author: JAinNH

customer_reviews.title: nice when new
customer_reviews.text: They are thick and comfortable, I liked them until I washed them, after the second time through the wash they hare so shrunken that I cant even force my feet into them. Great for a one time use but not for everyday wear.
customer_reviews.author: robert w harris

customer_reviews.title: Great socks
customer_reviews.text: These wool socks are wonderful. I bought them for Deer Hunting Season in northern Wisconsin. I wear then in my 800 gr insulated Danner boots. One morning it got down to 5 degrees, and I did a three hour sit. My feet got a bit cold. Other than that, they were toasty warm, all season. I wear these socks directly on my feet, with no additional liners. The only thing that goes in my boot is my bare foot with these socks on them. They are terrific. Very comfy and great cushion. My only complaint would be wanting them an inch or two longer, but that is just personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: RayJayTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: The BEST comfort socks!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend wear's Red Wing work boots just about every day and suffers from excessive moisture to his feet causing his skin to peel. He often has numbness to the ball of his feet after being on his feet all day. These socks have been a savings grace for him. They offer the right amount of cushion and compression in the sock to give him the comfort he needs. Most of all they keep his feet dry though out the day and the peeling of his skin has improved significantly. Especially in the Florida heat. I would highly recommend these socks.
customer_reviews.author: Emerald24

customer_reviews.title: Warm. Wish they came in all black.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: After washing them they are a perfect fit. Warm, comfy (but a bit loose the first time I wore them). I am a female, size 9 and bought small style KL. LOVE THESE. I haven't found anything warmer. I have Raynaud's so my feet are always cold. I wear them every day to work. I only wish they came in all black.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Toborg

customer_reviews.title: CUSHY AND COMFY AND WARM!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband LOVES his new socks! His old wool ones have finally been retired. Will be ordering more soon. Note: The gentleman who wrote his review on these was so impressive we had to try them. He was in the service and wore them all the time. So glad he wrote it. Really does help sell and help people pick the best of the bunch available. THANK YOU.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Cushioning
customer_reviews.text: Best hiking socks I've used so far. I prefer them over brand-named socks that are twice the price. These are comfy, keeps my feet dry, and provide nice padding between foot and shoe. They are durable as well. If you plan on washing and tumble-drying these (doable but not recommended with wool products), please keep in mind that they'll shrink quite a bit. I actually did this intentionally because they were too big when I received them.
customer_reviews.author: mitoboru

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and excellent for hiking
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to give these a true test on an 11-mile muddy hike that was cold to start and warmed up. My toes still were a little cold for the first two miles, but not terrible. By the time we really got rocking and rolling with sweat, my feet stayed dry and cool. By the time we were finished, no blisters! I was a little scared bc the fit was inconsistent and one sock had a bigger toe area than the other. Oh well, it didn't affect their performance. They worked great!
customer_reviews.author: KCap

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and not itchy!
customer_reviews.text: Wool socks almost always itch me, but these are heaven. So cushy and cozy without being skin tight and itchy. They definitely hold moisture though if wet. I wore them on a 2 day trek through the Vietnam jungle and did a million river crossings. They were like a wet sponge, so I ended up swapping them out for a thinner pair of socks that didn’t hold so much water. Other than that, they’re super warm and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Great for backpacking!
customer_reviews.text: I used these 3 pairs for my Philmont Scout Ranch trek and all the training leading up to that. Well over 100+ miles of wear. I would change these out midday with a dry pair (have very sweaty feet). Between these and the great fitting boots I got my feet were in great shape the whole trip. The socks survived several handwash and machine wash cycles. They still have a snug fit. These will be my go to socks for hiking now.
customer_reviews.author: HonkyTonkHero

customer_reviews.title: Got these for winter weather hiking. I used these ...
customer_reviews.text: Got these for winter weather hiking. I used these in tandem with some sock liners, and not only did these keep my feet warm at night, but they kept my feet dry on the trail and blister free.
customer_reviews.author: Just JD

customer_reviews.title: Soft and breathable
customer_reviews.text: these socks are so awesome and soft. I wear tactical boots all day, in summer it is very humid. I have hyperhidrosis and bought these to help manage the sweat. These are wondefully soft and comfortable. they are thick and feel as though they will last. The quality is awesome and they are so soft and lovely. Theyre really breathable and dont smell at all by the end of the day. thoroughly recommend for tradies or emergency services who have to sweat away in heavy boots all day every day.
customer_reviews.author: Kythrie

customer_reviews.title: These socks changed my life
customer_reviews.text: I bought these socks because my hiking boots are a bit too big and I was hoping thicker socks would help. Unfortunately I was wrong. But, all was not lost. I discovered the glory of these socks. They are incredible. How are my feet never hot nor cold? They turn sweaty feet into cool, airy walking machines. They make cold clammy toes feel warm and buttery. They are a fraction of the price of other wool socks. I am beyond belief. I am blown away at the amazing foot comfort and my years of ignorance. But today, better late than never, I know of good socks.
customer_reviews.author: Collin Scangarella

customer_reviews.title: Buy them! They're awesome
customer_reviews.text: Really great socks, incredible price, I'm impressed with how thick and comfortable they are. The mid weight is thick in my opinion, for sure going to buy the light weight for summer hikes. They've got an arch support band, had no issues with staying up or rolling down. Considering how thick they are, I haven't had issues with my feet sweating or feeling wet either. Never go away socks, please!
customer_reviews.author: Adventure Lady

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Decent socks for the price. They don't compare to Smartwool, but if you're on a budget and can't afford $20 per pair of socks, these are a good alternative. I bought them for a trip to Iceland in the summer. They were a little on the warm side as they are midweight, not lightweight. I'm sure they will come in handy when I visit family up north in the snow. The socks themselves didn't smell after wearing them all day, but my feet sure did! You've been warned ;)
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: they were the best option but my husband wants to check out other ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband really likes these socks and wants to move to only wool socks for the winter time now. The only reason that I didn't give it a 5 star review is because they shrink a bit in the wash/dryer. Not a huge deal, they still stretch back out to fit when you wear them but somewhat of an annoyance to have to deal with every time you wash them. For the price, they were the best option but my husband wants to check out other options before buying any more.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: "'tis better to have loved and lost than never to have loved at all"
customer_reviews.text: I had been in love with Meriwool socks six years. I was once told that all good things must come to a end - tear drop.. as you can see in the picture Thickness and quality are gone.. I’m almost scared to wash, it’s so hard to talk bad about something I have taken so much pride in wearing - now have to remove the polar bear sticker out of my sock drawer. My wife For years Never understood our relationship then caved and just said “ I don’t want to hear about how soft your socks are and don’t think about touching me with them” The good times...
customer_reviews.author: Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Great socks! Ordered s/m for 8.5 men’s shoe size.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered small/medium for my son. He wears a size 8.5 shoe. They fit him perfect. If you have bigger feet than that, you may want to order up. I could not find a size chart. (I ordered the multi color pack- the colors are great... a little more neutral than they look in the pictures). They are the perfect weight. She will be perfect for camping, hiking and skiing.
customer_reviews.author: BRat

customer_reviews.title: Bulky but works
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a ski trip, kept everyone's feet warm and dry. I've used these since for work and although they are bulky they keep my feet dry all day. Accidentally put them in the dryer and they did shrink. had to wash them again, stretch them out and air dry to get back to size.
customer_reviews.author: Dan A.

customer_reviews.title: Top notch for the money
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised with the first order. The socks are nicely cushioned and the toe seam is almost invisible. I've only had these for a short time so I can't rate the durability, visually they seem to be well made. I only gave them four stars on comfort because I find the elastic a little too tight on the uppers, but that's a personal preference. It didn't stop me from buying more. These are my "indoor" socks for wearing under my house shoes. My everyday work boot socks are Smart Wool trekking which I've used for years and years and many sets.They are great socks, comfortable and durable, but they also are three times the price of these Meriwools.
customer_reviews.author: W. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Had to toss one pair after washing
customer_reviews.text: It was really hard to pick a rating, I'd say more of a 3.5 stars. They were super comfy to wear in my hiking boots on my trip to Scotland but when I washed them, for some reason the lightest color pair shrunk like crazy. I don't know why, the other two (washed in the SAME load) were fine. I had to toss the pair away, they shrunk down too small to wear and the texture was spotty and thin, like the inside fell apart. But like I said... only one pair did this, shame because I only got 3/4 days out of it, what a waste of money. So yeah, comfy buuut... buy at your own risk when washing.
customer_reviews.author: Channy

customer_reviews.title: Best wool socks ever!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I both wore these socks every day during a recent trip to Lapland (Finland) in December. These socks kept my feet very warm. There were some days when the temperatures were -5 degrees Fahrenheit and I wore two pairs because I was outside 5+ hours. These are very thick and comfortable for long hikes. I wore the same pair several days and they never had any odor. I will be buying more of these in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Z.

customer_reviews.title: Best socks I've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: I got this funny email about hiking and nature as a way for these guys to ask me to review this product. I thought it was funny since I actually got these just to wear at work with a pair of dress shoes. That being said, these socks are great, I've above average foot sweat and after 8+ hours on my feet usually my shoes and old socks were potent enough to stink up an entire room. Since I go these socks I can go the same length of time and there's no noticeable smell at all! I was impressed enough the very first day to go order a second set.
customer_reviews.author: Common Sense

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't worn them hiking yet. Will update when I do. Wore them around the house and they were very comfortable and not itchy at all. Small fit my women's size 7 feet just fine. Update: Wore them for a strenuous 5+ hour, 10 + mile hike & they held up wonderfully. No blisters & absorbed a lot of sweat, they somehow didn't even smell after taking them off for the day. Washed them recently in warm water & dried them in the dryer forgetting you aren't supposed to & they seem 100% fine - really great socks, they exceeded expectations for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Police Officer Approved
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a conservation police officer so he is always outside in the timbers or out checking duck hunters. The other day he came home soaking wet from being outside all day and his boots and socks were wet but he said the socks still kept him warm all day despite the 35 degree weather. I plan on ordering more for Christmas gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Wine Wraps LLC

customer_reviews.title: Thick and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've only had these about a week now but they are very comfortable and thick. They're comfortable enough to wear every day with jeans. My feet also stay warm in the Chicago winter. I bought a set of the Alvada's before these. Those were decent, but they don't seem as sturdy as the Meriwool socks. I should know hopefully in a month how these hold up. I was wearing the Alvada socks everyday (rotating between 3 pairs) since October 20th. I pair seem to show signs of developing a hole. I like the Alvada's but think I will be purchasing more Meriwools in the future if these hold up well over the next month.
customer_reviews.author: James Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Great socks
customer_reviews.text: Great socks. I am an adult male with size 9 feet. These socks fit great. They even go over my extra large calves (Former weightlifter). I am very satisfied with the quality of the socks. I wore them hiking over a 15 mile trail . they were extremely comfortable. Highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: SavannahReader

customer_reviews.title: Kept me warm in Chicago!
customer_reviews.text: After winter in Chicago last year, I knew that I needed some warmer socks to help keep my feet warm. I loved the color of these as well as the durability. While they are a little thicker (as I expected them to be), they were still able to fit into my boots and under my skinny jeans. I will definitely buy these again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Overall for quality, price and durability...very good
customer_reviews.text: These socks are very good overall. They are medium heavy to heavy weight. Same thickness throughout. Warm and comfortable. However, they do a slight itch around the ankle/instep area of the foot, but not unbearable. Wash and dry instructions come with socks. Be sure to wash inside out before first wear. As you will see some of the dark color dye come off. Good socks for cooler/cold weather. Made in China.
customer_reviews.author: JAK

customer_reviews.title: Soft & comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable, soft socks. I was afraid that they were too thick to comfortably fit in my hiking boots. My worry was unfounded. Put both socks & hiking boots on & went for a 30 minute walk without a single bit of discomfort. Feet didn’t get hot or itchy from the socks, either. Washed all the pairs once without any sign of fraying, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Micknan

customer_reviews.title: Thick but defective
customer_reviews.text: These socks are thick which is why I bought it for extra cushion. Also its snug fit is just right for me. However, one sock out of 3 pairs has a defect. Color is whiter than any other socks & couldn't figure out its pair... but since I'll be wearing it over long pants, I kept it. Problem occured when. I washed for the 1st time & hung dried them. This discolored sock was soooooo tight, I could not put my foot in it. So if you notice the color difference, return it unless you can drop your shoe size. Bummer... I like these except for the above reason.
customer_reviews.author: M Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great wool socks, but very thick.
customer_reviews.text: Great wool socks. Fit as expected. Wear really good. Wick moisture well. Soft & comfortable. The only thing I don't like is they are very thick. Granted, that helps provide some cushioning, and it would be great for cold weather activities, I was looking for something in a mid-weight thickness. Would definitely purchase more, but save them for winter. Will be checking to see if Meriwool makes similar socks in a mid-weight.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Which wool socks to choose? These!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a pair of hiking boots and needed wool socks to go with them. After looking at many pairs I chose these because of the good reviews and praises about the cushioning. They also have a high percentage of Merino wool and that's recommended. The cushioning is excellent! Very cushy socks! I cannot speak to durability or wicking because I have only just received them and today was the first day I wore them. Thick and comfortable, and not itchy. They appear to be very well made. I like the spruce color and am happy I chose these :-)
customer_reviews.author: Salt & Light

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Used these while hiking in Ireland and never noticed any discomfort or even thought about them at all during the hike. They're fitted, but not too tight, water-wicking, insulated, comfortable, and work well with hiking shoes. They are definitely warm, so I do recommend wearing them mainly in rainy or colder weather.
customer_reviews.author: Larissa

customer_reviews.title: Not machine washable!
customer_reviews.text: These are not machine washable like my REI marino wool socks. They turned into scratchy balls of wool about 4 times smaller than before wash. Very disappointed as their low cut socks are great.
customer_reviews.author: psays

customer_reviews.title: warm fuzzies
customer_reviews.text: These socks fit perfectly and feel toasty warm. My feet freeze in the winter and I wear only wool socks then. I have had a hard time finding a generic blue color at times so love this 3-pack. The price is great and they are thick and warm. Another plus is they don't have tight elastic at the top which can make my legs ache. I have long narrow feet (sz 9.5) and slim ankles and calves so they are just right for me. For those with heavier calves and wide feet they might want to size up.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lou C

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: My whole family loves these. These are not super soft and they are not scratchy. The best description I can give is cozy. These are very thick, I would not be able to wear them with shoes (we live in Texas, so they are wonderful for chilly evenings/mornings at home, I suspect they would be great in much colder weather but I don't have first hand experience). They breath fairly well and are comfortably snug. I wash and dry them with our other socks and dry them in the dryer but they don't seem any worse for it. We are about to buy a 3rd box of these and I can't recommend them enough.
customer_reviews.author: AmyH

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable socks.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my whole family for our recent trip to Alaska. Now that I've worn them, I am pleased to say they are exceptional socks. I was expecting them to be itchy. They are not. They are soft and kept my feet both warm and cool/comfy at the same time. They are thick so don't wear them in just fitting shoes/boots. The weather was cool and damp and we did a lot of hiking. My feet were comfortable every day we went out hiking or on a boat. I washed them a couple times according to the packaging instructions and did not put them in the dryer. They washed very well and kept their shape perfectly. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: SuzanneK

customer_reviews.title: Ordered again!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted wool socks but did not want to buy one pair for $25. I found these to try out. After wearing, washing, and wearing again I was very satisfied that I ordered 9 more pairs. Wicks away moisture and my feet do not have odor after a 16 hour day of work like they do if I wear regular athletic brand socks.
customer_reviews.author: MS.Ott

customer_reviews.title: Really great product
customer_reviews.text: I am a knitter. Nothing beats a good wool sock in winter. These socks possess a notable difference from others I’ve made or bought. They have a unique quality of wear without odor over any other I’ve tried. I can wear these several times between hand washing. Their fiber remains thick and fluffy. They are very warm and have an excellent fit, not loose or baggy in the sole. And my feet are cozy and warm. I highly recommend these socks. Like all good wool socks I recommend you hand wash and lay out to dry ( never put in the dryer) and they will last you for a very long time. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: A*Libris

customer_reviews.title: NOT made to last!
customer_reviews.text: Have had excellent enduring socks from Cabela's, REI, Wigwam, etc; each lasting for years despite regular wearing and washing. While these MERIWOOL socks have similar material contents, they are simply garbage. Sure they are packaged nice and feel super thick out of the box.... but after one day of working in them on the farm. Toast. If you want socks to sit in front of the fire, try em out. If you want them to be functional, forget it! NOT made to last. See pic.
customer_reviews.author: J.Alan

customer_reviews.title: hooray for wool
customer_reviews.text: Is it blasphemy to purposely shrink wool? Anyway I did it and these fit much more comfortably on my feet, a narrow men's size 8, then they originally did. Still keeping toes super warm, almost too warm sometimes, unless in the snow. Fit under winter boots well (boots being half-size too big).
customer_reviews.author: restless

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit sceptical of buying these. I got them for work socks because my wife said they would help with my feet sweating. I recieved them and they were very thick. I thought these wont help with sweating if anything they will make it worse. Boy i coulnt have been more wrong. These socks are worth every penny. My feet dont even smell anymore even after being at work all day. I will definitely buy them again if the six pair i bought ever wear out
customer_reviews.author: Matthew david bardin

customer_reviews.title: Very thick - keep in mind for fitting into boots
customer_reviews.text: I bought these socks for hiking, but unfortunately returned them. They were nice and thick and seemed decent quality, but they really should have been advertised as thick/full cushion/winter weight. I normally wear "light" or "ultra light" wool hiking socks with my hiking boots, so these were so thick in comparison that I could barely fit my foot into the boot. So if you're going for these to wear with shoes that you already own, make sure you have enough room to fit a thick, full cushion sock!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your feet warm!
customer_reviews.text: These socks have been a huge blessing to me during this hunting season. My feet would oftentimes get cold while hunting. I didn't realize that wearing cotton socks only turns sweat to cold, damp moisture on your feet! These wool socks wick away the moisture, so my feet have been much warmer!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Mcateer

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great!
customer_reviews.text: These are my son's favorite socks of all time! They are warm on his feet, provide good sweat wicking, and they don't slip inside his athletic cleats. He loves these socks! These socks are slightly too thick for me. I prefer the People Socks wool. They are virtually identical, but slightly thinner.
customer_reviews.author: David S. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Put to the Test...and Beats all the Rest!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing like having comfort on your feet and toes, especially if you are a full-time pedestrian. I live in Florida, and I need comfort, sweat control and coolness all wrapped into one package. And, for a bonus, it's nice to be able to wash the heck out of a product and have it come out soft and supple every time. These socks pass every test with flying colors. Hands down, the best socks I've worn in decades. Excellent quality, comfort and they live up to their claim. I'd buy them again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: John J.

customer_reviews.title: Very TOUGH...
customer_reviews.text: These socks are THICK! They are built very well and feel like they are much higher quality than the price you pay for them. These are a great compliment to a minimalist shoe with little padding. They are very warm however, and in warmer weather, my feet sweat heavily in these. However, the wool does a great job of wicking the sweat away from my feet. Highly recommended for moderate to lower temps.
customer_reviews.author: Concilliator

customer_reviews.title: Great Socks
customer_reviews.text: Good Fit, but my next order I will go down a size I wear a 8.5 to 9 depending on the shoes so I went with a large and they work well after several washing and drying them. They are great for any outdoor activities. 2nd order - I ordered the smaller size and I am happy with both I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: PMayes

customer_reviews.title: Thick, warm socks.
customer_reviews.text: I really only use these for wearing around the house in the winter. They are nice and thick - I'd say on the heavy side of "midweight". They are ver warm, yet they wick moisture and breath well. My feet never get sweaty, even when wearing them with warm slippers. The elastic is good - they stay up and don't slide down. I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: UTBadger

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Purchase
customer_reviews.text: We live in snow country and warm socks are a must. We finally had to get some more and could not find what we previously owned without spending $30 per sock! We took a chance with ordering these and it totally paid off. These socks are thick, soft and so very comfortable!!!! We do not know the durability yet but they look very well put together. We went ahead and bought 4 more sets!
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded My Expectations
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I have to say that my experience with wool socks are the Kirkland brand from Costco and the one pair of Darn Tough socks that I wear for hiking. I purchased a 3-pack of Meriwool socks in preparation for a trip to Alaska and I could not be more impressed. The Meriwool socks are much thicker, softer, warmer, and overall more comfortable than the Kirkland brand. I plan on doing some serious lounging with these socks this winter. Unlike some other reviewers, I found the quality to be outstanding. My Alaskan brother in law liked them so much that I ordered a 3-pack for him too.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love these.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these socks!! They are so amazingly warm and comfortable! My pregnant wife's ankles seem to be too thick for them since they leave marks on her but I wear them all the time! They keep your feet warm but somehow, don't make you overly hot when the day warms up in the afternoon. Just make sure you don't dry them too hot.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Peregrin

customer_reviews.title: Very nice socks for the price
customer_reviews.text: Thicker than many wool socks I have purchased, these are extremely comfortable and warm. With great elasticity, they stay put all day. This was my second purchase because I was so impressed with the first batch.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great socks for hiking and/or keeping warm
customer_reviews.text: I was on a trip that would involve a lot of walking in cold weather mid 30's to low 40's, sometimes with a backpack. I bought a meriwool 3 pack and they were great! Comfortable, warm, excellent socks that handled many miles of city walking. One thing to note is that when you wash them it is probably best to let them air dry vs using a clothes dryer. I noticed that my socks shrunk a little in the dryer (still fit) but like all mostly wool products you have to be careful drying at too high a heat and shrinking the product.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Wilson

customer_reviews.title: thick socks good for snow
customer_reviews.text: These socks are thicker than the average merino wool socks you see in stores. They are very comfy and warm, too warm for conditions other than snow. I trekked in knee deep snow with these socks and my hiking boots for about 20 minutes and my feet stayed nice and warm and completely dry! Definitely would recommend for very cold weather but not for regular hiking or you feet will overheat and sweat.
customer_reviews.author: rubberducky

customer_reviews.title: Are you a woman that wears a size 11?
customer_reviews.text: If you are a woman that wears a size 11 - these wonderful, warm, comfy socks are for you! I searched and searched and searched. I ordered the XL on a whim because I wear a USA size 11. I am 5’11 and well, we tall gals come with a great foundation! I needed some socks that could withstand the wet rainy season of Normandy France, and these socks fit the bill! The socks are made in China (I usually don’t by things from China), they have a bit of compression and a bit of arch support- incredibly comfortable and warm! Wonderful find on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Marie G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: The best hiking/winter socks I have ever had. I love the Redhead socks had those for years was not able to find them again so I took a chance on these and holey moley they are even softer but just as comfortable and warm. I can't wait to put these on come winter time to keep my feet warm. I could tell immediately they are not as rigid as the Redhead socks so they will be even more comfortable during hiking. Will definitely buy more, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Glades Girl

customer_reviews.title: Very cushy & soft
customer_reviews.text: I bought the multi color pack in size Small PS. I wear a size 8 shoe comfortably. I bought a size 8.5 hiking boot from Columbia because I knew hiking socks would probably be thicker. These fit into my boot with no problem. They do not itch. I haven't hiked in them yet but wearing them around the house in my boots I did not feel too overheated. They are thicker than I expected though. I am glad I went up a half size in my boot order. I am pleased with these socks!
customer_reviews.author: Erin E. Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Excellent warm weather midweight sock.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these socks specifically becaue they were high content wool. I work and pursue rigorous outdoor activities and wool socks provide year round foot health and comfort. Wool seems to suppress foot odor as opposed to sticky synthetics. These are a mid weight that I can wear with some of my dressier shoes. Only time will tell on durability but the price is nice the quality appears that it will support longevity.They are soft and stay up well.
customer_reviews.author: Enigma

customer_reviews.title: Great Socks
customer_reviews.text: Wool socks are crucial for winter in Michigan if you plan to spend much time outside. These were an affordable price, comfy, and worked just my other wool socks. Feet get a little wet and stay warm. I wear them biking and running frequently with pleasant results.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great socks for hiking!
customer_reviews.text: Great socks! I purchased these specifically for hiking The Narrows in Zion National Park. I wanted something that would keep my feet warm while trudging through cold water and these were perfect! They were warm and thick but also fit nicely within my normal shoe size. I have only worn them a few times so I can’t speak much foe their longevity, but so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Toastie Tootsies!
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased to report that these socks are indeed warm. I have others that are near, but these are the warmest I've worn yet. The color does not appear to be as ordered, but that does not keep me from wearing them. Who sees boot socks anyway?
customer_reviews.author: Comfort Lover

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculously comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I rarely post reviews of products I purchase from Amazon but I was really blown away by these socks. Happiness = comfortable feet and if you need socks to keep your feet warm and dry in the cold weather look no further than these. My feet don't sweat when I'm moving around and they don't chill out when I'm not. They are slightly bulky but you'll appreciate the extra cushion when you walk around. You're just not going to find better socks at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Logan179

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable well made socks
customer_reviews.text: These socks appear to be well made and are very soft and comfortable. They feel as i they will be warm but I can't tell yet, 90 degrees outside. Update: These socks are very comfortable and warm. I wore them hunting in South Dakota and they kept my feet warm and dry. they are very cushiony and feel great on your feet.
customer_reviews.author: K.C. Jones

customer_reviews.title: His feet get cold all the time and they are great and he loves them
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my boyfriend. His feet get cold all the time and they are great and he loves them. He is a size 12-13 and I was worried they wouldn't fit as that tends to be a challenge... but they are great and fit comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Brit

customer_reviews.title: A perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent heavy weight wool blend socks. I use wool socks summer and winter because they keep me from getting blisters, don't get damp, and don't get smelly like cotton socks. In summer they are cool and in winter they are warm.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W.

customer_reviews.title: Beware of shrinking socks
customer_reviews.text: Socks were fine till first wash and dry. After drying on my normal heat setting they shrank. If you buy these socks do not dry on your normal heat setting only low or no heat at all. In my opinion should be more warnings of this on Packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Realworld

customer_reviews.title: 2 Days that was all it took.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these socks for a elk hunting trip, 1/2 way through day 2 of the hunt, Holes in the toes. I had ordered them early so I am now outside of the return window, and out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: John II.

customer_reviews.title: Thick wool foot coverings
customer_reviews.text: These are nice, beefy wool socks. I have been having trouble finding ones that are thick and cushy; with better technical materials even winter socks have been quite thin. If you, like me, want your feet enveloped in snug wool pillows, these are the ones!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these socks!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second order. Usually I dislike wool socks for their itchiness, but these surprisedly do not. They are thick and cozy and don’t make my feet sweat in warm snug fitting shoes. Great in the winter, not sure how these will do in the summer months in the northeast USA. I sort of wish they made a slightly thinner version for summer wearing.
customer_reviews.author: Lou H.

customer_reviews.title: OK But Will Shrink
customer_reviews.text: First pair of wool socks, purchased mostly because I liked the color(s). Comfortable, well-made, but very bulky, so these will make your shoes feel a half-size small. Also, if you put them in the dryer they shrink A LOT. After 3-4 wash/dry cycles I got rid of them because they were too small. Sure, I know you can air dry them and they probably won't shrink - but really? They're socks. I don't need washing / drying complications for something as basic as socks. I think these are well made and worth the money if you want wool. But no more wool for me.
customer_reviews.author: sheplover

customer_reviews.title: Comfy Socks at a Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Just received these socks in the mail. Went out on a whim and bought two packs. Glad I did! These socks are packaged neatly and shipped with care, and you can tell it's merino wool because of the instant comfort. No scratchy breaking-in period. I have yet to tell about the durability but, on feel alone, I would honestly equate them with the Smart Wool brand which I've used throughout the years with a ton of success; thus, I predict these socks will serve me well! Five stars for a small business doing an amazing job!
customer_reviews.author: Talia Harper

customer_reviews.title: Good work socks
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my grown son who works in a chemical plant to wear with his work boots. I had to buy an extra pack so he could have clean ones for the week. Thick and sturdy. I had bought some for me also for my boots. They are a little rough for me, but my son loves them and they look like they will last.
customer_reviews.author: Sandii

customer_reviews.title: Superior Warmth/Materials/Comfort  ....  #Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to replenish my supply of winter socks and am very well pleased with the construction, quality, warmth and comfort of these socks. Alone or with a liner (if *really* cold ;) these socks keep my feet nice and comfy. No less than a 5 Star Recommendation and I will be back for more ... Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Good weight, quality, and comfort
customer_reviews.text: These socks have been especially excellent for family members who have to stand most of the time at work (as well as those of us who don't). They add cushion, a bit of arch support, and temperature control, in short, all around comfort. Thus far they have stood up to daily wear and, with proper care, have been very durable. Every member of our family loves these socks.
customer_reviews.author: Tweakphile

customer_reviews.title: Great socks for work boots
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable, tighter than expected but my foot is at the bigger end of a "small", I think mediums would be too big though. So far I have dried them in a dryer on the delicate setting "inside-out",and haven't had any problems with shrinkage. Will update if I have any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good socks - good price
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with these wool blend socks. They are very comfortable and warm. I wear them with my boots when I go on my walks in cold weather, and my feet haven't been cold yet. I have washed them several times now and I laundered them as the instructions said and they have come out great. I will certainly buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Steven G.

customer_reviews.title: Best boot socks you can buy.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful heavy duty boot socks. Keep feet warm in the cold and dry in the summer. Been using these over a year now and have since that time added a dozen more pairs. Only boot sick I'll wear these days.
customer_reviews.author: David Chamberlain

product_meta.title: MERIWOOL Merino Wool Hiking Socks for Men and Women – 3 Pairs Midweight Cushioned – Warm n Breathable
feature_bullets: Package Includes: Set of 3 Pairs of Merino Wool Blend Winter Cold Weather Crew Length Socks for Men and Women

INCREDIBLY SOFT & COMFORTABLE: 75% Merino wool blend ensures comfort all day long – no itch! Each crew cut sock provides compression, arch support, and a reinforced heel and toe to ensure maximum comfort and protection for your feet. The rib knit design gives elasticity and an elastic cuff prevents bunching. 15% of each sock is made with durable nylon that reduces wear and tear while 10% is composed of stretchable elastic that keeps your socks from loosening.

BREATHABLE INSULATION: Keeping your feet cozy and warm in winter, these thermal boot socks won’t weigh you down or let your feet overheat while you are on the move outdoors. These insulating MERIWOOL unisex socks are machine-washable on cold settings and safe to tumble dry on low heat, so they’re ready when you are for your next adventure while working, hiking, trekking, camping, hunting, playing winter sports, mountaineering, ice fishing, skiing, snowboarding, and more.

WICKING & ODOR RESISTANCE: Merino wool’s natural wicking and odor-resistant properties keep you dry and comfortable while active in cold weather. Through the process of wicking, Merino wool is the most breathable fabric and absorbs moisture better than any other fibers. Wicking refers to a fabric’s ability to pull moisture away from your body and keep you comfortable.

EXCEPTIONAL CUSTOMER CARE: If your MERIWOOL Unisex Crew Socks do not perform to your satisfaction, return it to us within 90 DAYS along with your proof of purchase for a hassle-free refund, exchange, or replacement. Your garment is made with a Merino wool blend that is washer/dryer safe, but recommended to air dry.
